meanings.definition: A person who plays tricks or pranks.
meanings.sent1: The mischievous tricker hid fake spiders around the house for April Fools' Day.
meanings.sent2: The tricker at the party made everyone laugh with their clever jokes.
meanings.sent3: The tricker pretended to be a ghost and scared their friends for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was a master tricker, always coming up with new pranks.
meanings.sent5: The tricker's tricks were so funny that everyone wanted to be their friend.

meanings.sent1: The optical illusion was a tricker, making the object appear closer than it was.
meanings.sent2: The tricker in the magic show amazed the audience with its clever design.
meanings.sent3: The tricker mirror made her reflection look taller than usual.
meanings.sent4: The tricker in the movie plot kept the viewers guessing until the end.
meanings.sent5: The tricker in the puzzle led to a surprising solution that no one expected.

meanings.sent1: He tried to tricker his friends into believing he had superpowers.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to tricker anyone, but she needed to win the game.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox tried to tricker the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The con artist used his charm to tricker people out of their money.
meanings.sent5: The magician's illusion was so convincing that it could tricker even the skeptics.
